body_html:
Since GPU allocations are run on the CPU during the OpKernel::Compute() call, they run in parallel with actual GPU computations, so reducing this allocation probably won't improve performance by much.

Still, reducing allocation times always helps, especially when a GPU is not available. @zheng-xq, any thoughts?

Still, reducing allocation times always helps, especially when a GPU is not available. @zheng-xq, any thoughts?
body:
Since GPU allocations are run on the CPU during the OpKernel::Compute() call, they run in parallel with actual GPU computations, so reducing this allocation probably won't improve performance by much.

Still, reducing allocation times always helps, especially when a GPU is not available. @zheng-xq, any thoughts?
